titles: A merrie and pleasant comedy: never before printed, called A shoo-maker a gentleman As it hath beene sundry times acted at the Red Bull and other theaters, with a generall and good applause. Written by W.R. Gentleman.
author: Rowley, William, 1585?-1642?
publisher: Printed by I. Okes, and are to be sold by Iohn Cowper, at his shop at the east-end of St. Pauls Church at the signe of the Holy Lambe,
notes: Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
